question.text: You are driving past a line of parked cars. You notice a ball bouncing out into the road ahead. What should you do?

explanation.text: Beware of children playing in the street and running out into the road. If a ball bounces out from the pavement, slow down and stop. Don’t encourage anyone to retrieve it. Other road users may not see your signal and you might lead a child into a dangerous situation.

answer.text: Continue driving at the same speed and sound your horn
Continue driving at the same speed and flash your headlights
Slow down and be prepared to stop for children
Stop and wave the children across to fetch their ball
